page.title: 15BUILDINGS-THE PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The original parish church of St.Andrew and St.Mary was built of wood in Saxon times and on the same site as the existing church.When the Normans came they knocked it down and rebuilt it in the Norman style.The Norman church was built of red sandstone with round windows,round arches and massive pillars.The tower of the church collapsed and fell into the nave destroying that as well.So the present nave and tower was built between 1962 and 1964.The outside of the south transept is distinguished by a splendid half timber gable end frame work dating back to the middle ages.Whilst inside the finest feature must be the hammer beams supporting the very large and heavy roof.There are eight bells hung in the tower.
